description: Change of use from treatment and transfer of waste (Sui Generis) to business, general industry and/or storage or distribution (Use Classes E(g)(iii), B2 and/or B8) and/or treatment and transfer of waste (Sui Generis) (Departure from Local Plan)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): JHPRS205-P001 Location Plan, JHPRS205-P002 Block Plan, JHPRS205-P003 Floor Plans As Existing, JHPRS205-P004 Elevations As Existing, JHPRS205-P006 Rev B Floor Plans As Proposed, JHPRS205-P006 Elevations as Proposed.

Covering Letter dated 24 April 2020, Certificate of Conformity; Circular Economy Statement prepared by JLL dated May 2021, Energy Comments prepared by Helme + Partners dated 4 August 2021, Fire Comments prepared by Helme + Partners dated 4 August 2021, 5191/TS01 Transport Statement prepared by RGP dated April 2021.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Refuse and cycle storage shall be provided on site in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the commencement of the development and retained permanently.

Reason: To protect amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policies D6, SI8 and T5 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The sound insulation of the building envelope and of any mitigation measures shall ensure that noise from internal uses and activities is contained within the building, as assessed according to standards of the Council's SPG10 and criteria of BS8233:2014, at the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises incl. private external amenity spaces. Measures shall be implemented prior to use of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | A Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation of the site. The details submitted shall be designed to manage the transport needs of the users of the site, in order to demonstrate a car restraint policy for the site, minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport. The approved scheme shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of the development and shall be retained for the life of the development.

Reason: To promote the use of modes of transport, other than use of private motor vehicles, in pursuance of the Council's policies on sustainability in accordance with Policy T4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 1.1 of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012). | The Construction Logistics and Delivery and Servicing shall be implemented prior to the construction of works and implemented thereafter, in accordance with 5198/TS01 Transport Statement prepared by RGP dated April 2021.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the occupation of the site, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy T4 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | All internal alterations and renovation works of the existing buildings must incorporate inclusive access, in accordance with drawing numbers JHPRS205-006 Rev B Floor Plans as Proposed.

Reason: In the interests of ensuring that the built environment is safe, accessible and convenient and enables everyone to access jobs, opportunities and facilities, in accordance with Policy E5 of the London Plan (2021). | The Fire Statement, prepared by Helme & Partners, shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development and retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users, development proposals must achieve the highest standards of fire safety, in accordance with policies D11 and D12 of the London Plan (2021). | The Energy Statement, prepared by Helme & Partners, shall be implemented occupation of the site and retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmental sustainable development in accordance with policies SI1, SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan 2021, guidance note 11 of the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2018, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and Policy 2.5.36 (Best Practice) of the Mayor's Sustainable Design & Construction SPG. | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order, 1995 as amended, or any future amendments, the building shall be used only within Use Class E(g)(iii), B2, B8 and Sui Generis (Treatment and Transfer of Waste) of the Town & Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 as amended, and for no other purpose, without the prior written permission of the local planning authority.

Reason: To safeguard the Business or industrial uses on the site in accordance with Policy E4, E5, E6 and E7 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 1.2(b) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Prior to occupation of the use hereby approved, two car parking spaces should be provided with Active Electrical Charging Points (EVCP) and the remaining 8 car parking spaces should be provided with Passive Electrical Charging Points. The car parking shall be provided and managed for the life of the development.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for drivers of electric cars, in accordance with Policy T6 of the London Plan 2021 and Ealing Development (Core) Strategy policy 1.1(h).
